item.description:
Can we recover a physical literature? Can we recover a literature that is not merely read but felt? The library museum gestures at just such a possibility.

Source: Ode to the Library Museum → https://t.co/uRT9cxge4d
item.source:markdown:
Can we recover a physical literature? Can we recover a literature that is not merely read but felt? The library museum gestures at just such a possibility.
Source: Ode to the Library Museum → https://t.co/uRT9cxge4d

item.description: With new lights, this spot that I have walked across so many times looked different. I liked the shades of yellow amidst the shadows. I wish I could capture it better. https://t.co/29Z1NE68Gl
item.source:markdown: With new lights, this spot that I have walked across so many times looked different. I liked the shades of yellow amidst the shadows. I wish I could capture it better. https://t.co/29Z1NE68Gl

item.description:
Go to bed when you are tired, and allow your body to wake you in the morning (no alarm clock allowed).

Source: Can You Catch Up on Lost Sleep? → I agree with this “no alarm clock” part wholeheartedly. When you wake up consistently, without an alarm, ... https://t.co/eT0MmqX5ky

item.description:
Against all odds, Netflix’s adaptation of The Sandman is a very good show. But why does it look like that? You know what I’m talking about—the so-called “Netflix Look.”

Source: Why Does Everything On Netflix Look Like That? → https://t.co/IEDvsTocTt
item.source:markdown:
Against all odds, Netflix’s adaptation of The Sandman is a very good show. But why does it look like that? You know what I’m talking about—the so-called “Netflix Look.”
Source: Why Does Everything On Netflix Look Like That? → https://t.co/IEDvsTocTt

item.description: I wish there was a technology that could capture the smell you are experiencing, just the way you can the colours with a camera. Some smells give such bliss and are so unique (at least to my nose) that I wish I could capture and share the joy with my dear ones.
item.source:markdown: I wish there was a technology that could capture the smell you are experiencing, just the way you can the colours with a camera. Some smells give such bliss and are so unique (at least to my nose) that I wish I could capture and share the joy with my dear ones.

item.description: For cord-cutters, leaving pricey cable packages behind in favor of streaming is a win for the wallet. Because we’re able to sign up for monthly plans, it’s easy to jump into a streaming service and jump out when prices increase or content dries ... https://t.co/WKPY7AG7gd

item.description: @AmazonHelp You have missed them terribly. You misplaced 2 orders, delayed by 2 days. And then your support says it will take another 3 days. This is with the one-day delivery promise on both orders.
item.source:markdown: @AmazonHelp You have missed them terribly. You misplaced 2 orders, delayed by 2 days. And then your support says it will take another 3 days. This is with the one-day delivery promise on both orders.

item.description: The quality of @amazonIN's prime delivery has significantly degraded in recent times. Two orders in two days that were out of delivery were marked as "attempted delivery" when the agents didn't even arrive at our houses. The delivery agency's found a loophole they are milking.
item.source:markdown: The quality of @amazonIN's prime delivery has significantly degraded in recent times. Two orders in two days that were out of delivery were marked as "attempted delivery" when the agents didn't even arrive at our houses. The delivery agency's found a loophole they are milking.

item.description: Here’s a word cloud of my posts that I created in 2008 – I had been blogging for around 2 years then. I find it funny that even then I was writing the most about “blog”. Apparently, meta-commentary never goes out of fashion. https://t.co/2fO2zPgP6z
item.source:markdown: Here’s a word cloud of my posts that I created in 2008 – I had been blogging for around 2 years then. I find it funny that even then I was writing the most about “blog”. Apparently, meta-commentary never goes out of fashion. https://t.co/2fO2zPgP6z

item.description:
I understand why Google is doing the #GetTheMessage campaign. I also understand why it would hardly affect Apple. It’s a loss for users all over the world though. https://t.co/tKNXfdeAyb

Is Apple breaking my texting experience? No, hardly anyone uses SMS anymore. Would I love a standard? Absolutely.
item.source:markdown:
I understand why Google is doing the #GetTheMessage campaign. I also understand why it would hardly affect Apple. It’s a loss for users all over the world though. https://t.co/tKNXfdeAyb

item.description:
A place to discover books in new and exciting ways. Read the first page without judging the cover. If you’re hooked, click the reveal button to find out more.

Source: Recommend Me a Book → https://t.co/cc1il8U4CB

item.description: I am not a horror movie fan. I have seen a few over the years but do not enjoy them. With age, my patience with them has further gone down. I do not watch this genre at all anymore. Or so I thought. I was recently reminded of my dislike as I read this ... https://t.co/oZnRyLOL4z

item.description: I watched The Gray Man today – mindless action is not entertainment to me. I had fun when it was in superhero films. It doesn’t here.
item.source:markdown: I watched The Gray Man today – mindless action is not entertainment to me. I had fun when it was in superhero films. It doesn’t here.
